it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions

Class LsaAllNeighborsAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions.AbstractAction<List<? extends ILsaMolecule>>
      • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions.LsaAbstractAction
        • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions.LsaStandardAction
          • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions.LsaRandomNeighborAction
            • it.unibo.alchemist.model.implementations.actions.LsaAllNeighborsAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAction<List<? extends ILsaMolecule>>, ILsaAction, Serializable

    public class LsaAllNeighborsAction
extends LsaRandomNeighborAction
    The execution involves all neighbours. The molecule can be different from a neighbor to the other, because some special Variable (#D) are specific for each node. This is why N molecules are instanced if there are N neighbours.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
